Package apryraz.eworld

Class EnvelopeFinder

java.lang.Object
apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
public class EnvelopeFinder
extends java.lang.Object
This agent performs a sequence of movements, and after each movement it "senses" from the evironment the resulting position and then the outcome from the smell sensor, to try to locate the position of Envelope

    This set of variables CAN be use to mark the beginning of different sets of variables in your propositional formula (but you may have more sets of variables in your solution).
    (package private) java.util.ArrayList<org.sat4j.core.VecInt> futureToPast
    Array of clauses that represent conclusiones obtained in the last call to the inference function, but rewritten using the "past" variables

    SAT solver object that stores the logical boolean formula with the rules and current knowledge about not possible locations for Envelope

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    EnvelopeFinder​(int WDim)
    The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Envelope World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnvelopeFinder

      public EnvelopeFinder​(int WDim)
      The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Envelope World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.
      Parameters:
      WDim - the dimension of the Envelope World

  • Method Details

    • setEnvironment

      public void setEnvironment​(EnvelopeWorldEnv environment)
      Store a reference to the Environment Object that will be used by the agent to interact with the Envelope World, by sending messages and getting answers to them. This function must be called before trying to perform any steps with the agent.
      Parameters:
      environment - the Environment object

    • loadListOfSteps

      public void loadListOfSteps​(int numSteps, java.lang.String stepsFile)
      Load a sequence of steps to be performed by the agent. This sequence will be stored in the listOfSteps ArrayList of the agent. Steps are represented as objects of the class Position.
      Parameters:
      numSteps - number of steps to read from the file
      stepsFile - the name of the text file with the line that contains the sequence of steps: x1,y1 x2,y2 ... xn,yn

    • getState

      public EFState getState()
      Returns the current state of the agent.
      Returns:
      the current state of the agent, as an object of class EFState

    • runNextStep

      public void runNextStep() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Execute the next step in the sequence of steps of the agent, and then use the agent sensor to get information from the environment. In the original Envelope World, this would be to use the Smelll Sensor to get a binary answer, and then to update the current state according to the result of the logical inferences performed by the agent with its formula.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • moveToNext

      public AMessage moveToNext()
      Ask the agent to move to the next position, by sending an appropriate message to the environment object. The answer returned by the environment will be returned to the caller of the function.
      Returns:
      the answer message from the environment, that will tell whether the movement was successful or not.

    • moveTo

      public AMessage moveTo​(int x, int y)
      Use agent "actuators" to move to (x,y) We simulate this by telling to the World Agent (environment) that we want to move, but we need the answer from it to be sure that the movement was made with success
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal coordinate (row) of the movement to perform
      y - vertical coordinate (column) of the movement to perform
      Returns:
      returns the answer obtained from the environment object to the moveto message sent

    • processMoveAnswer

      public void processMoveAnswer​(AMessage moveans)
      Process the answer obtained from the environment when we asked to perform a movement
      Parameters:
      moveans - the answer given by the environment to the last move message

    • DetectsAt

      public AMessage DetectsAt()
      Send to the environment object the question: "Does the detector sense something around(agentX,agentY) ?"
      Returns:
      return the answer given by the environment

    • processDetectorSensorAnswer

      public void processDetectorSensorAnswer​(AMessage ans) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Process the answer obtained for the query "Detects at (x,y)?" by adding the appropriate evidence clause to the formula
      Parameters:
      ans - message obtained to the query "Detects at (x,y)?". It will a message with three fields: DetectorValue x y

      DetectorValue must be a number that encodes all the valid readings of the sensor given the envelopes in the 3x3 square around (x,y)

      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses

      public void addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      This function should add all the clauses stored in the list futureToPast to the formula stored in solver. Use the function addClause( VecInt ) to add each clause to the solver
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • performInferenceQuestions

      public void performInferenceQuestions() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      This function should check, using the future variables related to possible positions of Envelope, whether it is a logical consequence that an envelope is NOT at certain positions. This should be checked for all the positions of the Envelope World. The logical consequences obtained, should be then stored in the futureToPast list but using the variables corresponding to the "past" variables of the same positions

      An efficient version of this function should try to not add to the futureToPast conclusions that were already added in previous steps, although this will not produce any bad functioning in the reasoning process with the formula.

      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • buildGamma

      public org.sat4j.specs.ISolver buildGamma()
      This function builds the initial logical formula of the agent and stores it into the solver object.
      Returns:
      returns the solver object where the formula has been stored

    • coordToLineal

      public int coordToLineal​(int x, int y, int offset)
      Convert a coordinate pair (x,y) to the integer value t_[x,y] of variable that stores that information in the formula, using offset as the initial index for that subset of position variables (past and future position variables have different variables, so different offset values)
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the position variable to encode
      y - y coordinate of the position variable to encode
      offset - initial value for the subset of position variables (past or future subset)
      Returns:
      the integer indentifer of the variable b_[x,y] in the formula
